page.title: 06BIRDS
page.content: During the month of June 1985, an ornithological survey was carried out in the Beaulieu Heath Western area adjoining the A326. The site covered twelve square kilometers of land consisting of heathland, bog areas, Forestry enclosure, woodland, farmland and conurbations with the ESSO refinery complex. The habitat within the survey site was varied accomodating a large resident species as well as catering for Summer and Winter visiters.In addition the areas adjoining the S.W.,S. and E sides of the site have a wealth of excellent habitats. With such a rich area it is not surprising to locate a large number of resident and visiting species. Although winter visiters have not been mentioned R.S.P.B. records show that they are as prodigeous as the Summer species.
